entry.title: WIND WARNING , Mary's Harbour
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 10:20 PM NST Wednesday 25 January 2023

entry.title: BLOWING SNOW ADVISORY , Mary's Harbour
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 10:25 PM NST Wednesday 25 January 2023

entry.title: Current Conditions: Clear, -20.0°C
entry.summary:

Visibility: 16.1 km

entry.title: Wednesday night: Clear. Low minus 25.
entry.summary: Clear. Wind northwest 20 km/h gusting to 40 becoming light this evening. Low minus 25. Wind chill minus 22 this evening and minus 34 overnight. Risk of frostbite. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Wednesday 25 January 2023

entry.title: Thursday: Chance of flurries. High minus 3. POP 60%
entry.summary: Increasing cloudiness. 60 percent chance of flurries late in the afternoon. Wind up to 15 km/h. High minus 3. Wind chill minus 33 in the morning and minus 13 in the afternoon. Risk of frostbite. UV index 1 or low. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Wednesday 25 January 2023

entry.title: Thursday night: Snow or rain. Temperature rising to plus 4 by morning.
entry.summary: Cloudy. 60 percent chance of flurries early in the evening. Snow beginning in the evening then changing to 60 percent chance of rain showers or drizzle overnight. Blowing snow late in the evening and after midnight. Snowfall amount 10 cm. Wind southeast 20 km/h increasing to 50 gusting to 80 in the evening then becoming south 50 gusting to 80 except gusting to 110 along parts of the coast overnight. Temperature rising to plus 4 by morning. Wind chill minus 13 in the evening. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Wednesday 25 January 2023
